action.action-desc: Mrs. Bustos (for herself and Mr. Braley of Iowa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to remove the maximum payment amount for certain qualified losses under the Traumatic Injury Protection under the Ser­vice­mem­bers’ Group Life Insurance program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Taylor Morris Act.

section.header: Removal of maximum payment amounts for certain qualified losses under Traumatic Injury Protection under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance program
section.text: Section 1980A(d) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking and the maximum payment and inserting and, except as provided by paragraph (3)(A), the maximum; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: The maximum payment amount described in paragraph (1) shall not apply to a qualifying loss directly caused by a traumatic event described in subparagraph (B). The Secretary shall determine the payment schedule for such qualifying losses as the Secretary determines appropriate without regard to such maximum payment amount.
A traumatic event described in this subparagraph is one of the following:

clause.text: Training under conditions simulating armed conflict.
A traumatic event caused through an instrumentality of war.
